reqs:
Soci 102 replaces Soci 100B.
Important Notices regarding Undergraduate Registration!
SOCI 100 (6) Introduction to Sociology, SOCI 101 (3) Social Interaction and Culture and SOCI 102 (3) Inequality and Social Change have formally replaced SOCI 100C (6), SOCI 100A (3) and SOCI 100B (3), respectively. SOCI 101 and SOCI 102 are together deemed to be equivalent to SOCI 100 and can be taken in any order. This means that students have the option of completing six credits of introductory sociology in a single 6-credit course or in two 3-credit courses.
Soci 102 replaces Soci 100B.

description: Inequality, institutions, social structure and social change. Credit will be granted for only one of SOCI 102 or SOCI 100.
